votebox.middle.view.widget

Class FocusableLabel

  • java.lang.Object
    • votebox.middle.view.widget.FocusableLabel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IDrawable, IFocusable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Button, ToggleButton

    public class FocusableLabel
extends java.lang.Object
implements IFocusable
    This is the simplest implementation of an IDrawable. Labels are simply window decoration. Labels cannot be interacted with by the voter.

      • getReviewImage

        public IViewImage getReviewImage()
        Description copied from interface: IDrawable
        Call this method to get the "review screen version" of any particular drawable. The review screen version of a drawable is scaled differently to fit a particular reveiw screen layout. Note that this method should be called on drawables that aren't, themselves, members of the review screen. This method should be called by behavior in said review screen drawables, in the process of determining which image represents the "currently selected drawable" of any given group.
        Specified by:
        getReviewImage in interface IDrawable
        Returns:
        This method returns the review screen version of any drawable.
        See Also:
        IDrawable.getImage()

      • initFromViewManager

        public void initFromViewManager(IViewManager viewManagerAdapter,
                       IBallotLookupAdapter ballotLookupAdapter,
                       IAdapter ballotAdapter,
                       IViewFactory factory,
                       IBallotVars ballotVars)
        The location on disk that the image wrappers will use to do the loading of the images depends on the uid, size, language. There is *one* special case here: if the uid is "reviewtitle", append the number of selections the ballot thinks have been made onto the uid. Therefore, if there have been 4 selections made in the ballot, the uid of this element should be interpreted as "reviewtitle4". Because we need a reference to the ballot lookup adapter in order to check the number of selections, we must insert this behavior here.
        Specified by:
        initFromViewManager in interface IDrawable
        Parameters:
        viewManagerAdapter - The drawable can use this adapter to make calls to the view manager.
        ballotLookupAdapter - The drawable cna use this adapter to look up information in the ballot. This adapter cannot affect the ballot's state.
        ballotAdapter - Use this adapter to change the state of the ballot.
        factory - Use this to construct the new images.
        ballotVars - The path to the image file is here.

      • imagePath

        protected java.lang.String imagePath(IBallotVars vars,
                         java.lang.String uid,
                         int size,
                         java.lang.String lang)
        Construct the full path to an image given several parameters.
        Parameters:
        vars - This is the vars object that has the ballot bath.
        uid - This is the image's unique id
        size - This is the image's size index
        lang - This is the image's language abbreviation.
        Returns:
        This method returns the path to the image.

      • imageToggleButtonPath

        protected java.lang.String imageToggleButtonPath(IBallotVars vars,
                                     java.lang.String uid,
                                     java.lang.String lang)
        Construct the full path to an image given several parameters. It loads an image to represent the selected options (except No Selection) for the review page.
        Parameters:
        vars - This is the vars object that has the ballot bath.
        uid - This is the image's unique id
        lang - This is the image's language abbreviation.
        Returns:
        This method returns the path to the image.

      • focus

        public void focus()
        This method focuses the element. An element is considered to be focused when the user used an input device (directional hardware buttons or a mouse) to dictate that he is currently wanting to "look" (and possibly select) the item.
        Specified by:
        focus in interface IFocusable
        See Also:
        IFocusable.focus()

      • unfocus

        public void unfocus()
        Call this method to unfocus the element. An element can only be unfocused if it has previously been focused.
        Specified by:
